Course Content: Introduction to database concepts: data abstraction/independence, data models (entity-relationship model, object oriented model, relational/network/hierarchical model), database languages (ddl, dml), database administrator/user. Storage and file structures. Indexing and hashing. Relational model: formal query languages (relational algebra, relational calculus), commercial query languages (sql). Relational database design: integrity constraints, data dependencies, normal forms. Transaction processing and concurrency control.
